TopicTitle: What are the two blue icons on maneuver node?

Articles.Content:
When you right-click a maneuver node, three icons appear on it. A red "x" that deletes the node, and two blue icons with some unreadable symbols on them. What do they do?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-18T22:06:43Z" title="06/18/2015 10:06  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 18, 2015</time> by Sharpy**

Clicking the right one moves the maneuver node one orbit forward in time, the left one moves it back. I find these to be particularly useful when plotting a rendezvous; you can set up a node that intercepts with your target's orbit and then click the right button to allow additional time for phasing if you're going to be arriving early at the target orbit.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-18T14:25:56Z" title="06/18/2015 02:25  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 18, 2015</time> by A\_name**

Hi Sharpy, they are for moving to the next and preceding orbit, basically forwards and backwards in time and the buttons have a "-" and a "+" on them ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Ninja'd by A\_name!
